slides.title: TypeScript
slides.subtitle:
Typed JavaScript for Scalable Applications
From JavaScript to Enterprise-Grade Code

box.content: Typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript

list.text: Static Typing - Optional type system for JavaScript
Tooling - Better autocomplete, refactoring, and error detection
ESNext Features - Use latest JavaScript features today

note.text: Fun fact: TypeScript was first released in 2012 and has become one of the most loved languages according to Stack Overflow surveys!

list.text: Runtime Errors - Type-related errors only at runtime
Refactoring - Difficult to safely refactor large codebases
Team Scale - Hard to maintain consistency in teams
Bugs - Catch errors during development, not production
Early Error Detection - Catch errors in IDE
Scalability - Better for large applications and teams

box.code:
# Install TypeScript globally
npm install -g typescript

# Install in a project
npm install --save-dev typescript

# Check TypeScript version
tsc --version

# Compile a TypeScript file
tsc app.ts

# Initialize TypeScript configuration
tsc --init

# Using npx
npx tsc app.ts

# Using yarn
yarn add --dev typescript

list.text: Static Typing - Types checked at compile time
Static Advantages - Early error detection, better tooling
Use strict mode - Enable all strict type checks
Avoid any - Use unknown instead for dynamic values
Prefer interfaces - For object shapes, use type aliases for unions
Use type inference - Let TypeScript infer types when possible
Leverage utility types - Use built-in type helpers
Design for extensibility - Use generics and composition
Expert - Type system internals, compiler API, advanced patterns
What's the difference between interface and type alias?
When should you use unknown vs any?
How do you create a type that makes all properties optional?
What's the purpose of type guards?
How do you type React component props?
TypeScript adds static typing to JavaScript
Catch errors early with compile-time type checking
Better tooling with autocomplete and refactoring
Scalable for large applications and teams
Works with all major frameworks and libraries
